critique: This executive order establishes the President's Council on Physical Fitness and Sports. It aims to improve the physical fitness of Americans through various programs and initiatives. It involves multiple federal agencies and seeks to coordinate efforts at the federal, state, and local levels. There is no direct indication of a liberal or conservative ideological tilt. It doesn't directly address immigration. It expands executive power slightly by creating a council and committee. It centralizes power at the federal level by coordinating federal agencies and encouraging state and local governments to participate in national programs. It doesn't directly address national security or civil liberties. It involves government in promoting physical fitness, but not in a way that directly regulates the economy. It promotes social inclusion by aiming to improve physical fitness for all Americans, including the disadvantaged and handicapped.
